intro: Anthistiria fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered anthistiria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, giving it its common name. Anthistiria fasciculata is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
